title: 106_hr1561
content: The "Tax Equity Preservation Act of 1999" is cited as the short title. The Act repeals the alternative minimum tax on individuals. The Tax Equity Preservation Act of 1999 repeals the alternative minimum tax on individuals for taxable years beginning after December 31, 1998. Amendments are made to various sections to reflect this change. Amendments are made to various sections including subsections (d) of section 24, subsection (c) of section 26, paragraph (6) of section 29(b), and paragraph (3) of section 30(b) to reflect the repeal of the alternative minimum tax on individuals. Amendments are made to section 30(b) to limit the credit allowed for any taxable year by the regular tax reduced by other credits. Section 32 is amended by striking subsection (h), and section 53(d) is amended to define "net minimum tax." Amendments are made to limit the credit allowed for producing fuel from a nonconventional source or under section 30. The term "tentative minimum tax" is defined as zero for non-corporate taxpayers. Subsection (b) of section 55 is amended to specify the amount of tentative minimum tax. The alternative minimum tax is calculated as 20 percent of the excess alternative minimum taxable income over the exemption amount, minus the foreign tax credit. Alternative minimum taxable income includes adjustments from section 56 and tax preference items from section 57. Taxpayers subject to regular tax will also be subject to this alternative minimum tax. The exemption amount for the alternative minimum tax is $40,000 and will be reduced by 25 percent for taxpayers with alternative minimum taxable income over $150,000. Adjusted basis of property under certain sections is also addressed in the amendments. The amendments to sections 56, 58, and 56(a) of the tax code involve striking and redesignating subsections and paragraphs to streamline the treatment prescribed in the tax code. Section 58 is repealed, with amendments to sections 56 and 59 regarding taxable years before January 1, 1999. Subsection (h) of section 59 is modified, and section 59(a)(1) is amended to simplify the language. The amendments to various sections include changes to the pre-credit tentative minimum tax, striking subsections in sections 59 and 382, redesignating subparagraphs in section 641, and amending subsections in sections 666 and 772. The amendments involve changes to sections 847, 848, 871, 877, and 897 regarding nonresident alien individuals and foreign corporations' gain or loss from the disposition of US real property interests. The amendments made in this section apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 1998.
